newsitem.title: DUBAI: Yields rise at latest Saudi treasury bill offer.
newsitem.headline: Yields rise at latest Saudi treasury bill offer.

text.p: Yields rose on this week's two billion riyals worth of one-month to one-year Saudi treasury bills on offer by the Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency, bankers in the kingdom said.

The yield on 28-day bills was 5.7130 percent from 5.6497 last week and the rate on 91-day bills was 5.8334 percent from 5.7300. The 182-day bills yielded 6.0273 percent from 5.9453 and the rate on 364-day bills was 6.3741 percent from 6.3566.
One-month interbank deposits were quoted at 5-7/8, 3/4 and three-month funds were at six, 5-7/8. Six-month deposits were at 6-3/16, 1/16 and one-year interbank rates were at 6-1/2, 3/8.
